# minimumInteritemSpacing

**Instance Property**

The minimum spacing (in points) to use between items in the same row or column.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var minimumInteritemSpacing: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the delegate does not implement the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCollectionViewDelegateFlowLayout/collectionView(_:layout:minimumInteritemSpacingForSectionAt:)] method, the flow layout object uses the value of this property to set the spacing between items in the same line.

For a vertically scrolling layout, the value represents the minimum spacing between items in the same row. For a horizontally scrolling layout, the value represents the minimum spacing between items in the same column. The layout object uses this spacing only to compute how many items can fit in a single row or column. The actual spacing may be increased after the number of items has been determined, as illustrated in [/documentation/appkit/nscollectionviewflowlayout/1402872-minimuminteritemspacing#1965632].



The default value of this property is `10.0`.

## Configuring the Item Spacing

- **minimumLineSpacing**: The minimum spacing (in points) to use between rows or columns.
- **estimatedItemSize**: The estimated size of items in the collection view.
- **itemSize**: The default size to use for items.
- **sectionInset**: The margins used to lay out content in a section.
